item.title: Report X-2023110503
item.description:
Report X-2023110503

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-25
  • City: BROOMFIELD
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: This hazmat was discovered leaking during outbound at around 9:00pm. The package handler who discovered noticed it leaking while transferring hazmat from the IC rollers to trailer 136. The package handler was wearing gloves and says the liquid did not contact their skin. The manager called QA who placed the hazmat in a plastic bag and tote and cleaned floor of trailer. DescribePack: The jug has a loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was placed in a plastic bag and bin.

item.title: Report E-2023110314
item.description:
Report E-2023110314

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-27
  • City: DENVER
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The team returned back from there pick up and noticed the bottom corner of the IBC box had was damp about 1-2 inch in length at the bottom corner and a damp spot on the pallet about 2 inch in diameter. Management was notified and our in house response team dawned the proper PPE and proceeded to repack the container into a new one. The reason for the failure was due to the contents rubbing against the inner liner.

item.title: Report E-2023110288
item.description:
Report E-2023110288

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10/19/23 a trailer at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility in Henderson, CO was observed to be leaking. Upon investigation it was discovered that three 28-gallon plastic bins containing IV bags fell over while in transportation due to the shipment not being properly secured. After the containers fell, some of the IV Bags fell and ruptured due to weight and impact. Approximately 15 gallons released onto the trailer floor and ground beneath the trailer. Facility personnel conducted cleanup operations.

item.title: Report X-2023110132
item.description:
Report X-2023110132

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-25
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023110132 SequenceEvent: QA was called to trailer 830060 in the unload pkg. was on ground wet and leaking out so QA placed inside a lined tote and took to hazmat cage. DescribePack: Closure came loose and liquid leaked out soiling outer carton and inner bottles. DurationRel: 13 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. was placed inside a lined tote and was taken to hazmat cage to get inspected. 2. X-2023110133 SequenceEvent: Pkg. was in hazmat cage when I arrived inspected, and barcode was not readable had to do research and found tracking # got help from another trk# from the same shipper. This was unprocessed had no OP-900 on outer carton. DescribePack: Closures came loose and caused the liquid to leak out and soil outer carton and inner bottles. DurationRel: 13 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. was placed inside a lined tote and was taken to hazmat cage.

item.title: Report E-2023110040
item.description:
Report E-2023110040

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-10
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The contractor advised they found the leaking container which was a 55-gallon metal drum of " Premium Windshield Wash Concentrate". There was a small puncture on the side of the drum that was the cause of the release although the origin is unclear. The contractor states they were not able to see any released material outside of the trailer. The product was contained to the trailer floor in a 6'x4' area. The puncture to the drum was small and was stifled by the plastic wrap around it so the leak was slow and a majority of the product had evaporated by the time the contractor arrived. (1) 95-gallon DM containing 1 55-gallon metal drum of Premium Windshield Wash Concentrate and (1) 55-gallon DM containing Premium Windshield Wash Concentrate-impacted spill pads, plastic wrap, PPE, and Pallet Pieces of waste were created and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023101434
item.description:
Report X-2023101434

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-21
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Plastic jerrican without overpack. Liquid droplets in exterior of bung closure show pH consistent with contents. Container does not appear to be visibly leaking but is not safe to ship with acid on exterior. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.
